title: Neurobiological Markers of Post-Stroke Rehabilitation

author: Enrico Tongiorgi, Department of Life Sciences, University of Trieste

segmentation: So good morning.
I'm very pleased to be here today and to take to tell you something about the current knowledge of the neurobiological markers in post stroke rehabilitation.
I will start by giving you a general overview, but in this case it will be at the cellular level so.

A stroke, as you heard from the presentation of Doctor Roitz, is a devastating neurological condition that is derived for a permanent or transient interruption of the blood flow, and there are several events that occur and they are shared with other neurological diseases.
In fact, if you look at this central part of this picture, it highlights some of the consequences.
Of a stroke on one side or traumatic injury and on the other side of chronic neurodegeneration.
